net.medcommons.modules.services.interfaces
Interface DocumentService

public interface DocumentService

DocumentService manages MedCommons documents.

Method Summary

Method Detail

registerDocument

java.lang.Long registerDocument(java.lang.String guid,
                                java.lang.String storageId,
                                java.lang.String[]... additionalRights)
                                throws ServiceException
Adds a document and adds requested rights for a document. The identity passed as "principal" will be registered as principal for the document. Additional users can be granted rights by passing the given map which should contain mappings from MedCommons IDs to rights to be granted to those ids for the document.

Note1: a registered document must have locations stored in the document_locations table in central. Currently this is performed separately to this call by the storage layer itself. As the document must be registered prior to any locations being stored it is important to call this service before physically storing the document itself.

Note2: in a POPS scenario we may wish to accept documents from a user who does not have a MedCommons Id. Current plan (7/24/06) is that all such documents will be assigned medcommons ids, but this must be done prior to this call.

Parameters:
principalAcctId - - medcommons id to become principal of the document
guid - - guid of document
additionalRights - - an unlimited number of 2d arrays in the form [ id, right ] specifying additional accounts to be granted rights to the document.
Returns:
- the document id
Throws:
ServiceException

registerTrackedDocument

TrackingReference registerTrackedDocument(java.lang.String trackingNumber,
                                          java.lang.String storageId,
                                          java.lang.String guid,
                                          java.lang.String pinHash)
                                          throws ServiceException
Registers a document to a pre-allocated tracking number. The PIN associated with the tracking number will be updated to the specified value.

This call MUST return an error if the existing tracking number is already associated with a document, or if it has a non-NULL PIN value.

Parameters:
trackingNumber -
guid - - the guid (sha1) of the document being registered
pinHash - - the sha1 hash of the PIN to be used for accessing the document
Returns:
Throws:
ServiceException

acceptDocument

void acceptDocument(java.lang.String mcId,
                    java.lang.String guid,
                    java.lang.String status)
                    throws ServiceException
Sets this document to Accepted status. To an end user this translates to the document moving from their desktop to their Unvalidated folder.

Parameters:
mcId - - medcommons id for which the document should be accepted
guid - - the guid of the document to change status of.
status - TODO
Throws:
ServiceException

rejectDocument

void rejectDocument(java.lang.String mcId,
                    java.lang.String guid)
                    throws ServiceException
Rejects the document. This operation would probably only be available for a document which has not been accepted. From a user perspective it may translate to the document no longer appearing on their desktop.

Note that the document will still be stored in MedCommons and may be accepted by another user or even un-rejected by this user.

Parameters:
mcId - - medcommons id for which the document should be rejected
guid - - the guid of the document to reject.
Throws:
ServiceException

addDocument

void addDocument(java.lang.String storageId,
                 java.lang.String guid)
                 throws ServiceException
Creates a Document for a document to be at a specified node with an encryption key. The values of integrityStatus will be set to VALID (zero) and the integrity check time will be set to the current server time.

resolve

DocumentReference[] resolve(java.lang.String accountId,
                            java.lang.String guid)
                            throws ServiceException
Attempts to resolve the given guid in the context of the given account and returns reference information describing the location and status of the document.

The requested account MUST have rights to the document requested for this call to succeed. If not the service MUST return an error code and no document information.

Parameters:
accountId -
guid -
Returns:
Throws:
InsufficientRightsException - - if the requested account is declined access to the specified guid
ServiceException - - if an error occurs

grantAccountAccess

                        throws ServiceException

Parameters:

accessBy - - account id of account that should be granted access

ServiceException

inheritRights

void inheritRights(java.lang.String fromAccount,
                   java.lang.String toAccount,
                   java.lang.String storageAccount,
                   java.lang.String guid)
                   throws ServiceException
Duplicates all rights available to fromAccount for accessing document specified by 'guid' to account toAccount. No rights are removed from fromAccount.

Note: if fromAccount has global access rights to the storage id associated with 'guid' then this right will also be duplicated, thus granting toAccount the same global access to all documents stored under this storage id.

Note2: as an optimization, if the toAccount and fromAccount are equal, rights are not duplicated. However it is better to avoid calling this function in the first place for that situation.

Parameters:
fromAccount - - account currently having rights
toAccount - - account which should gain rights
storageAccount - - account under which document is stored
guid - - document
Throws:
ServiceException

getAccountPermissions

java.util.EnumSet<Rights> getAccountPermissions(java.lang.String storageId)
                                                throws ServiceException
Return the set of rights available for the current authorized user to perform operations on the given storageId account.

Throws:
ServiceException

net.medcommons.modules.services.interfaces
Interface TrackingService

public interface TrackingService

IdentityService is responsible for verifying user credentials, tracking numbers and PINs and mapping these to medcommons ids.

Method Summary
 java.lang.String allocateTrackingNumber()
          Allocates a new unused tracking number and returns it for use.
 DocumentRegistration registerTrackDocument(java.lang.String storageId, java.lang.String guid, java.lang.String pinHash, java.lang.String[]... additionalRights)
          Registers the given document and creates a tracking number for it, accessible via the given pinHash according to the specified rights.
 void reviseTrackedDocument(java.lang.String trackingNumber, java.lang.String pinHash, java.lang.String guid)
          Updates a specified tracking number with a new guid.
 void revokeTrackingNumber(java.lang.String trackingNumber, java.lang.String pinHash)
          Requests revocation of the given tracking number.
 java.lang.String trackDocument(java.lang.String guid, java.lang.String pinHash)
          Allocates a new, unique tracking number for the given document guid and adds rights for the tracking number to view the document.
 void updatePIN(java.lang.String trackingNumber, java.lang.String oldPinHash, java.lang.String newPinHash)
          Updates the specified with a new PIN
 TrackingReference validate(java.lang.String trackingNumber, java.lang.String pinHash)
          Validates the given trackingNumber and pin combination.
 

Method Detail

trackDocument

java.lang.String trackDocument(java.lang.String guid,
                               java.lang.String pinHash)
                               throws ServiceException
Allocates a new, unique tracking number for the given document guid and adds rights for the tracking number to view the document.

Note1: possibly we should require the document to first be registered via DocumentService.registerDocument. If not then a side effect of this call must be to register the Document in MedCommons as otherwise rights cannot be granted to the tracking number. If this latter methodology is adopted then it may be necessary to add the MedCommons Id of the sender as an optional argument.

Note2: a post condition of this call is that calling validate() and passing the returned tracking number and pinHash will return the MedCommons Id for the document.

Parameters:
guid - - the guid for the document
pinHash - - the sha-1 hash of the PIN required to access the document
Returns:
- a new, globally unique tracking number
Throws:
ServiceException

allocateTrackingNumber

java.lang.String allocateTrackingNumber()
                                        throws ServiceException
Allocates a new unused tracking number and returns it for use. The new tracking number is not associated with any document or PIN. These fields must be set null.

Note: the it is expected that the tracking number will later have a document associated with it via the DocumentService.

Returns:
- the new tracking number
Throws:
ServiceException

registerTrackDocument

DocumentRegistration registerTrackDocument(java.lang.String storageId,
                                           java.lang.String guid,
                                           java.lang.String pinHash,
                                           java.lang.String[]... additionalRights)
                                           throws ServiceException
Registers the given document and creates a tracking number for it, accessible via the given pinHash according to the specified rights.

Note1: a post condition of this call is that calling validate() and passing the returned tracking number and pinHash will return a TrackingReference for the document.

Note2: in current implementation the MedCommons Id may be passed as all (16) zeros. This causes a MedCommons Id to be created as equal to the tracking number itself with four zeros appended.

Parameters:
storageId - - id under which document is to be stored
guid -
pinHash -
additionalRights - - an unlimited number of 2d arrays in the form [ id, right ] specifying additional accounts to be granted rights to the document.
Returns:
Throws:
ServiceException

validate

TrackingReference validate(java.lang.String trackingNumber,
                           java.lang.String pinHash)
                           throws ServiceException
Validates the given trackingNumber and pin combination. If valid, returns the MedCommons Id for that combination. If not valid, returns an error.

Parameters:
trackingNumber -
pinHash -
Returns:
TrackingReference containing information regarding the specified tracking number
Throws:
ServiceException

revokeTrackingNumber

void revokeTrackingNumber(java.lang.String trackingNumber,
                          java.lang.String pinHash)
                          throws ServiceException
Requests revocation of the given tracking number.

After a successful revocation future requests to resolve the same tracking number MUST refused.

Revoked tracking numbers will not be re-used by the system.

Parameters:
trackingNumber - - the tracking number to be rescinded.
pinHash - TODO
Throws:
ServiceException

reviseTrackedDocument

void reviseTrackedDocument(java.lang.String trackingNumber,
                           java.lang.String pinHash,
                           java.lang.String guid)
                           throws ServiceException
Updates a specified tracking number with a new guid.

Parameters:
trackingNumber - - the tracking number to update
pinHash - - the hashed PIN for the specified tracking number
guid - - the new guid to be returned for the tracking number
Throws:
ServiceException

               java.lang.String oldPinHash,
               java.lang.String newPinHash)
               throws ServiceException
Updates the specified with a new PIN

Parameters:
trackingNumber - - tracking number to update
oldPinHash - - the old PIN
newPinHash - - the new PIN
Throws:
ServiceException

net.medcommons.modules.services.interfaces
Interface HipaaService

public interface HipaaService

Responsible for handling all transactions involving the HIPAA log.

Method Summary
 java.lang.String query(java.lang.String mcId, java.lang.String trackingNumber, int maxLines)
          Retrieves lines from the HIPAA log for the given MedCommons Id and tracking number.
 void updateHipaaStatus(java.lang.String mcId, java.lang.String trackingNumber, java.lang.String status)
          Updates the status of the given tracking number to the given string.
 

Method Detail

updateHipaaStatus

void updateHipaaStatus(java.lang.String mcId,
                       java.lang.String trackingNumber,
                       java.lang.String status)
                       throws ServiceException
Updates the status of the given tracking number to the given string. It is not determined yet whether this will update an existing line in the hipaa log or create a new one, but a call to retrieve log lines for this track# should return this entry as the most recent one as a post condition of this call.

Parameters:
mcId - - the medcommons id for which the tracking number is to be updated
trackingNumber - - the tracking number to be updated
status - - the new status for the entry
Throws:
ServiceException

query

java.lang.String query(java.lang.String mcId,
                       java.lang.String trackingNumber,
                       int maxLines)
                       throws ServiceException
Retrieves lines from the HIPAA log for the given MedCommons Id and tracking number. The log lines are returned in an XML form.

Parameters:
mcId - - the medcommons id for which the tracking number is to be updated
trackingNumber - - the tracking number to be updated
Throws:
ServiceException

All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class DocumentReference
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable

A reference to a document. It identifies the document and also it's location and possibly other useful metadata.

See Also:
Serialized Form

Field Summary

          Value of Accepted Satus flag indicating that a document has been viewed and accepted by the user.

          Value of Accepted Satus flag indicating that a document has been saved as a draft by a user but never sent.
static java.lang.String ACCEPTED_STATUS_NEW
          Value of Accepted Status flag indicating that a document is New

          Timestamp for creation of the document.
private  java.lang.String guid
          Guid of the document.

          Name/id of node where this document is located.
private  DocumentLocation[] locations
          Locations where this document exists.

          The account id under which the document is stored.

Constant Field Values

guid

private java.lang.String guid
Guid of the document.

location

private java.lang.String location
Name/id of node where this document is located. We may need a richer description of this.

acceptedStatus

private java.lang.String acceptedStatus
The status of whether this is Document has been accepted by a user. This is only relevant when in the context of a specific user.

creationDate

private java.util.Date creationDate
Timestamp for creation of the document. Not certain if this is needed, but it may be necessary to include this kind of metadata so that the recipient of a reference can evaluate it to determine if they are interested in retrieving the whole document. We also have to account for privacy constraints.

storageAccountId

private java.lang.String storageAccountId
The account id under which the document is stored.

Locations where this document exists.
